intro: Hetaeria shikokiana, commonly known as the Shikoku hetaeria, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
